reviews.review_msg: Dr. Rintoul is the best professor I've ever had he is amazing! I've taken 205 and 405 with him now, and 405 was by far my favourite class at SFU. He is funny and engaging in class, the content is extremely interesting, and his tests are consistent. I highly recommend taking any class with him, especially 405!

Gordon is an amazing professor. He explains things really well while being funny at the same time. He also tells you exactly what you do and don't need to know for the exams during lecture. Midterms were very fair and no surprises. You don't need to read the textbook to get a good grade. Highly recommend this prof and class!

Just about done the semester with Dr. Rintoul, and he has been awesome! This class is essentially an introduction to BPK 306 if you've ever taken that. You do have to study for his exams as he tests on a lot of information at once, he'll do his best to make sure you know what's important. Highly recommend!

Gordon is a great professor, his exams are easy for a STEM class (almost too easy, don't expect a curve) and the topics covered in this course (particularly the 2nd half) are very intriguing. In addition, he has many office hour sessions leading up to exams, and will in answer any and all questions.

Gordon is the most amazing and nicest professor at SFU. He offers extra office hours and he explains everything clearly. BISC 405 was a very nicely structured course and there is not one single thing that I got bored of The lectures are video recorded. For the tutorials, you need to make a group presentation and participations matters.

Amazing above and beyond prof. Anything he talks about more than once or for longer than a couple minutes will be tested so remember that. Super clear explanations, straightforward exams with no surprises. I would take a course with him again and again. This class is content heavy but for sure do-able, Gordan makes it very enjoyable with his humour
Best BISC department prof by a mile. Has great lectures and is very helpful and nice. The tests are heavy but mostly due to the large amount of material.

Gordon is honestly the best. He's very passionate about neurobiology, and cares that we clearly understand concepts discussed. He has tons of office hours leading up to exams and encourages questions. Very test heavy (80% of grade), with a presentation. He covers A LOT of material, but his tests focus on concepts and mechanisms, not small details.

Top-notch professor. The course was interesting and reasonably heavy in its content. Professor was clear and fair in what he asked on exams. Even though lectures are recorded, you feel compelled to come due to the overall atmosphere of his lectures. 10/10

Best prof ever! Doesnt want you to learn stuff you dont need to know. Super clear about whats on the exam and whats not. Doesnt lie or try to trick you. Focus on the things he spends time on as those will be on the exam!

I took him for both BISC 305 and 405. He is really nice and very approachable and even available to spend most of office hours for his students. He wants everyone to do well. He is super nice guy. You won't regret taking the courses with him!

I enjoyed this class a lot! He posted lecture recordings which were helpful because his lecture slides were mostly figures. The material is interesting to learn, especially when he talks about neurodegenerative diseases. Tutorial was separate from the lectures, we were mostly graded on a presentation. Also has extended office hours for exams!
Gordon is a super easy prof, listen to what he tells you know and just know that for the exam and bam you should get an easy A.

Absolutely amazing, funny, and caring professor who really goes out of his way to help you succeed in his classes. He covers a lot of material in the course but let's you know exactly which concepts he's going to test you on. Gord is also always available to answer questions outside of class and has the best office hours of any professor at sfu.

Gordon is the BEST prof hands down. Extremely considerate of students and takes into consideration that they have other exams/courses. Just show up to class and take notes! Bring a recorder in case you miss anything and you'll do fine. Exams were super fair but MC can be a little tricky. All profs should aspire to be Gordon!
